Sentencas: A novel sensor for detecting the early stages of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems has been developed.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The sensor was manufactured by inkjet printing a colloidal suspension of ceramic powders to create thin (20 mu m) catalytic and conductive elements of the sensor.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The catalytic elements are composed of a Ni-YSZ cermet.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The Ni-YSZ cermet was prepared with a concentration below the percolation limit (20 vol.%) of nickel, ensuring a low electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: As coke forms on the catalyst material, the nickel nodules in the Ni-YSZ are connected by electrically conductive carbon and the conductivity of the catalyst material increases, indicating coke formation.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: Sensors were tested in a 1% ethylene environment to induce coking.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The sensor showed a strong response to coking by producing a signal on the order of hundreds of millivolts.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The mass of the coke load was determined to be below the detection limit of available thermogravimetric analyzers (TGA) (< 10 mu g).
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: The coke load was further examined with a field effect scanning electron microscope (FESEM) and was found to be primarily carbon nanofibers.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems

Sentencas: Carbon nanofibers 10-50 nm in diameter connected nickel nodules in the sensors catalyst material resulting in the observed change in resistance.
Titulo: Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems
Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems
Development of an impedance-based sensor for detection of catalyst coking in fuel reforming systems
